terms.definition:
is a gear card found in the Summer Cyrus Limited Release/White Box Expansion.

Card Text.
 Affinity Bonus: +1 strength and +1 evasion token for each reroll token you have.

Crafting Requirements.
 does not require a specific settlement location to craft, and may instead be crafted at any time during the settlement phase by meeting the requirements found in the gear recipe section on the reverse face of the card.
Gear Recipe.
1x 
1x Fresh Acanthus

See Also.
Sighing Sarong
Sighing Acanthus Hat

Notes.
When initially released in the Summer Cyrus kit, the card had square-cut corners and the blue beta content banner printed on the card.

is a rare gear card found in the Lion God Expansion.

Card Text.
Unique, Accessory, -1 evasion
+2 strength while attacking with daggers or katars. You may move up to 2 additional spaces when you pounce.

is a Hybrid Armor Set from the Gambler's Chest Expansion. It is unlocked by crafting the Beast Hunter Helm. Its armor points value is 5.

Card Text.
Feinting Shot: Spend to move your survivor 3 spaces away from the monster. Activate and attack with a bow or arrow in your gear grid. This attack gains +3 accuracy and +3 range.

is a seed pattern gear card found in the Gambler's Chest Expansion.

Card Text.

Select an from the discard pile and place it on top of its Basic Action. The next time the monster performs Basic Action, it performs the selected card at -1 speed instead.

is a pattern gear card found in the Summer Goth white box expansion.

Card Text.
+1 Evasion.

When you are hit roll 1d10. On a 7+, you narrowly avoid it. Ignore the hit.
Crafting Requirements.
In order to obtain the , survivors must complete the requirements found on the Blackstar Bikini pattern card.

See Also.
Ghost Garters - Arms (Gear)
Ghost Garters - Legs (Gear)

Brave Dirndl is a pattern gear card found in the Oktoberfest Aya holiday white box expansion.

Card Text.
Once per lifetime, when you are a returning survivor and this is the only armor you are wearing, gain +1 courage . If your settlement has Song of the Brave, gain +1 permanent strength too!
Crafting Requirements.
In order to obtain the Brave Dirndl, survivors must complete the requirements found on the Brave Dirndl pattern card

Cloth is a starting gear card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game. Starting Survivors begin the game with this gear in their gear grid.

Card Text.
The Cloth protects your waist. Gain 1 armor point at the waist hit location.

is a gear card found in the Gambler's Chest Expansion.

Card Text.
Immortal Spin: Spend to move 3 spaces forward. Then if you moved 3 spaces, activate a melee weapon with +1 strength for each bleeding token you have.

is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
There is a dead stillness in the air. The atmosphere becomes thick with worry and the survivors carry on nervously. A bitter, evil cold sets in and there is no shelter.

The survivors huddle together for warmth, shivering loudly. Unless a survivor has armor gear at each hit location, they lose quarry monster level survival.

survival up to the survival limit.

The extra weight is great leverage.
All clubs in your gear grid gain Sharp.

5x Organ
7x Iron
16x Leather

Crafted from iron, this heavy armor includes ear plugs to drown out the terrible sounds of monsters and frightened fellow survivors.

2x Lantern Armor Kit sprues (makes 4 miniatures)
4x Plastic bases and inserts

See Also.
Lantern Armor Set

is a beta armor proficiency card found within Aya - Lantern Armor Limited Release/White Box.

Rules.
When a survivor is wearing a full Lantern Armor set, they may select Lantern Armor for their weapon proficiency type instead of a weapon.

During the Aftermath, the survivor is eligible to gain a proficiency rank if they suffered damage during the showdown. In order to claim the benefits of Specialization and/or Mastery, the survivor must be wearing a full Lantern Armor set and claim its armor set bonus card.

Lantern Armor Proficiency.
Specialization.
Add 1 Armor to all hit locations. Ignore the accuracy and movement penalties from Lantern Armor.

Mastery.
All your attacks gain the club gear keyword. Increase the range of your Perfect hits by 1.

Opposing Force: When a monster would collide with you, you may suffer damage equal to its movement and prevent it from moving any further. End the monster's movement adjacent to you and do not suffer collision.

Leather Armor is an Armor Set from the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Add 1 Armor to all hit locations.

You ignore bash.

Total Cost.
2x Hide
1x Bone
1x Scrap
5x Leather

Crafted from tanned hides and lantern scraps, leather armor is tough and light. Most importantly, it reduces impacts and helps bring out a survivor's masochistic side.

is the default campaign in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game. It uses the default timeline and survivor record sheets found in the core rule book and does not require any special changes to the game's rules, innovations, settlement locations, etc. It tells the story of a settlement around a hoard of glowing lanterns struggling for survival against monsters, starvation, and other dangers.
Story Events.
The timeline begins with Returning Survivors and ends with Showdown: Watcher. There are several nemesis encounters and other story events in specific years of the timeline, as well as story events triggered by certain milestones.
